ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to conduct research
Independent research and writing a paper
This course helped me gain insight into the field of research and conduct personalized study habits to complete my project.
Evolutionary/reproductive biology research; wet lab skills (assay, sample isolation); data analysis; scientific writing
How to conduct an experiment, write a thesis, and learn intimately in a lab setting.
Research project development skills, scientific writing skills, statistical analysis skills

I developed skills surrounding the design and implementation of a rigorous scientific experiment and was able to learn to work to come up with solutions to problems as they arose over the course of the research project.

Throughout my time in my lab, not only did I learn a lot of microbiology techniques but I also learned how to think like a scientist. From analyzing the current data that I had to coming up with new hypotheses to investigate why the current data did not fit that of the current hypothesis, I was able to refine my skills and thought processes as a scientist.
I learned how to conduct an experiment, analyze data, and subsequently write up my results.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Excellent advisor made this class very strong
Maybe some more checkpoints from the organizer, since people have very different experiences with their advising
It was great.
I really appreciated the meetings and support I had from Marta Wells and the members in my lab or who oversaw the project.

This course is well designed to allow a student to learn critical skills involving experiment development, literature review, and scientific writing. A potential weakness of the course could be the lack of clear milestones, but I did not find this to be a problem.

Since I was able to work one-on-one with my advisor throughout the entire course, it really helped me in identifying the key points that I needed to focus on for my projects and my I was able to learn a lot about the particular subject that my advisor was an expert on. I think the independence that this course gives for the student to pick and choose the project and field of study they are interested in is very great and motivates the student to do even better as it is something they feel motivated to study.
This is a thesis course, so the individual experience of any student will be based on the nature of their research. The required format for the final thesis paper was very clear and easy to follow.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Essential to graduate but fun nonetheless
You have to take it if you are a senior EEB major, but it's good if you have a good lab and advisor.
Yes! A 2 semester thesis is a great way to make sure your project is not rushed.
Yes! Necessary for E&EB graduation with a BS but also great to nail down those independent research skills.
Yes I would, I enjoyed the feeling of designing and completing a research project and the chance to be self-driving for the course of the project. It gave me confidence for research going forwards.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student as it allows for independency to explore your own project, but also provides close support from an experienced advisor that one could definitely gain a lot from.
I would highly recommend all E&EB students take this course and write a thesis; it was the most intellectually challenging part of Yale, and it was well worth the work.
